business.headline: What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

entertainment.headline: Farah Khan cites Deepika Padukone's schedule as cook Dilip wants to invite star Farah Khan, who directed Deepika Padukone in her debut film 'Om Shanti Om', recently spoke about the actor's busy schedule. She was responding to her cook, Dilip, who wanted to invite the star for a vlog.

Saif Ali Khan recalls earning Rs 1,000 a week with unusual demand from producer Saif Ali Khan shared that during his early Bollywood days he earned just Rs 1,000 a week, with the unusual condition of kissing the producer on the cheek ten times. He describes the 1990s as a "net practice" era of trial and error, before breaking through with films like 'Dil Chahta Hai' and 'Omkara'.

Ankita Lokhande shares Pavitra Rishta's Navratri memories with Sushant Singh Rajput Ankita Lokhande recently shared a nostalgic 'Pavitra Rishta' clip featuring late Sushant Singh Rajput, recalling their iconic on-screen chemistry.

They Call Him OG box office day 2: Pawan Kalyan film slows down after huge opening Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' shattered records with a Rs 100 crore India opening and Rs 144 crore worldwide debut, surpassing Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' and Prabhas' 'Saaho'. Despite a sharp day-two drop, the gangster action thriller continues its strong box office run.

Homebound box office day 1: India's Oscar entry sees a Rs 30 lakh opening Neeraj Ghaywan's Oscar entry 'Homebound' opened to a modest Rs 30 lakh at the Indian box office, despite international acclaim and a star cast of Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor.

Rani Mukerji reacts to wearing daughter Adira initials to National Film Awards Rani Mukerji shared the heartfelt reason behind the customised necklace bearing her daughter's initials at the National Film Awards, symbolising her daughter's presence on her special day. She also spoke about women's freedom to choose their paths in a male-dominated industry during the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Rahul-Tina are still relevant: Rani Mukerji cherishes National Award-win with SRK Actor Rani Mukerji appeared at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 for the session titled, 'Queen of Reinvention: National Award to Motherhood, Winning it All'. She shared her Rahul Tina moment at the National Award and also spoke about her character in 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway'.
Backstage Siblings: From living room jams to sold-out shows Backstage Siblings, India's first jamming band by siblings Raghav and Prachi, performed on Day 2 of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Rani Mukerji says her father was heartbroken on National Award snub for Black Actor Rani Mukerji spoke at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She recalled the time when her father was heartbroken over her not winning a National Award for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Black'.

Rani Mukerji on 30 years of movies, faith, patience and her 1st National Award Rani Mukerji opens up on her first National Award win for 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway', sharing her 30-year journey, memories of her late father, and the joy of winning alongside Shah Rukh Khan at India Today Conclave 2025.

Suriya and Jyotika's daughter makes directorial debut with Leading Light Diya Suriya, daughter of Tamil actors Suriya and Jyotika, has made her directorial debut with the docu-drama short 'Leading Light'. The film has gained recognition with an Oscar Qualifying Run at Los Angeles' Regency Theatre.

Min Yoongi Treatment Center by BTS' Suga moves fans with personal touch BTS' SUGA launches Min Yoongi Treatment Center in Seoul in partnership with Severance Hospital. Facility adopts MIND programme to help children and young adults on the autism spectrum.

Bobby Deol says his family feared him during his alcoholism, been sober over a year Actor Bobby Deol spoke about his struggle with alcoholism during a difficult phase of his career, expressing regret over the fear his family experienced during the time.

Aryan Khan's The Ba***ds of Bollywood season 2 in the works, confirms Rajat Bedi Actor Rajat Bedi has confirmed that 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' will return for a second season. The show marked Aryan Khan's directorial debut and received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike.

Saif Ali Khan recalls near-fatal knife attack: Walking away unscathed is miraculous Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan survived a terrifying knife attack at his Mumbai home earlier this year. Describing his escape as miraculous, he talks of how he fought off the intruder despite a severe injury. He is now recovering while preparing for upcoming film projects.

Thamma trailer: Ayushmann, Rashmika promise folklore, fear and fun this Diwali Ayushmann Khurrana plays a vampire of sorts in 'Thamma', produced by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films. The film is a part of the Indian horror-comedy universe, and also features Rashmika Mandanna and Nawazuddin Siddiqui in lead roles.

Cinema and the big AI question: Can machines make movies with heart? As Sunny Leone's AI-driven film 'Kaur or Kore' leads the way in AI storytelling, we discuss whether Artificial Intelligence revolutionises filmmaking or kills creativity. IndiaToday.in speaks to the industry experts on the future, fears and legal battles of AI in cinema.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood feels like one big party with no plot to go home to Aryan Khan's debut series attempts to reveal Bollywood's underbelly including nepotism and scandals. The show's chaotic narrative and overplayed themes sparked mixed reactions among viewers.

Boney Kapoor says ex-wife Mona Shourie bought his and Sridevi's wedding rings Boney Kapoor discusses the challenges of balancing two families and the effect on his children. Kapoor reveals his first wife Mona Shourie Kapoor bought the wedding rings for both him and Sridevi.

general news.headline: Absurd theatrics: India slams Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif at UN over his speechIndia sharply rebuked Pakistan at the UN after PM Shehbaz Sharif reiterated Islamabad's stance on Kashmir during his address to the General Debate of the 80th UNGA.

Centre may extend Parliamentary panels' terms by 2 years, boost for Shashi TharoorWhile changes in committee chairs are unlikely, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, who chairs the external affairs committee, could retain his position for another two years despite recent differences with his party.

US Senator backs Trump's H-1B crackdown, plans bills to put American workers firstSenator Tom Cotton threw his weight behind H-1B visa reforms, saying he will soon introduce legislation to tighten oversight and put American workers first.

Heavy rain pounds Hyderabad, roads flooded, 1,000 evacuated as River Musi overflowsThe heavy rain has put low-lying areas at risk, with Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy instructing officials to evacuate people immediately.

Rahul-Tina are still relevant: Rani Mukerji cherishes National Award-win with SRKActor Rani Mukerji appeared at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 for the session titled, 'Queen of Reinvention: National Award to Motherhood, Winning it All'. She shared her Rahul Tina moment at the National Award and also spoke about her character in 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway'.

5 killed as speeding Thar crashes into divider on national highway in GurugramThe incident happened at Exit 9 of National Highway-48 when the car, overspeeding, collided directly with the divider after losing balance. Five people, including three women and two men, died on the spot, while one man was critically injured.

India get a wake-up call, need a Super Over to shake off Sri LankaAsia Cup 2025, IND vs SL: India extended their winning run in Dubai, but they were tested by Sri Lanka in their final Super 4 match. Pathum Nissanka's 107 went in vain as Sri Lanka tied with India before losing the Super Over on Friday, September 26.

Elon Musk, Trump ally Steve Bannon among fresh names in 3rd batch of Epstein FilesHouse Oversight Committee documents show late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein maintained ties with Elon Musk, Peter Thiel, and Steve Bannon after his 2007 plea deal, releasing 8,544 files amid partisan disputes.

How a 16-year-old AI prodigy is shaping the future of technologyAt just 16, Raul John Aju has already made a mark as an AI prodigy, founder, and educator. From building robots at the age of 12 to teaching thousands globally, he is shaping the future of artificial intelligence.

Why BJP chose Biplab Deb for a crucial state like West BengalBiplab Deb's journey within the BJP, from a Delhi-based karyakarta to the Chief Minister of Tripura and now a Lok Sabha MP, reflects both political acumen and organisational grit.

'I Love Muhammad' row escalates in UP's Bareilly; over 2 dozen detainedThe controversy began with an FIR in Kanpur on September 9 over banners with the slogan, and has since spread to other states. Political leaders including Asaduddin Owaisi, Tejashwi Yadav and Akhilesh Yadav criticised the government's handling of the issue.

Abhishek Bachchan trolls Pakistan after Shoaib Akhtar's live TV gaffeBollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan trolled the Pakistan cricket team after Shoaib Akhtar confused him with Abhishek Sharma ahead of the Asia Cup final between India and Pakistan. Bachchan's witty remark struck a chord with the fans online.

How Dr Rami Kaminski coined 'otrovert', the word Internet can't stop talking aboutThere's a new personality trait on the block, and it's all over the internet. You have probably already come across it. The man who coined it, Dr. Rami Kaminski, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, decodes the term.

Couples duped, poor women exploited as ED unravels Hyderabad surrogacy racketCouples were charged around Rs 30 lakh for the process, purportedly meant for the surrogate. However, the probe revealed that in several cases, the children handed over were not biologically related to the commissioning parents.

Go back to Pakistan: Bangladeshi Diaspora Protests against Yunus outside UNMembers of the Bangladeshi diaspora held a protest outside the United Nations in New York against interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus, citing increased atrocities on minorities. The demonstration reflected ongoing unrest and deepening divisions following last year's regime change in Bangladesh.

PM Modi's mega digital push: To launch nationwide 4G towers, swadeshi networkPrime Minister Narendra Modi will launch nearly 98,000 new 4G towers and a fully indigenous 4G network today. This move aims to enhance digital access nationwide and position India as a global telecom manufacturing leader.

Homebound box office day 1: India's Oscar entry sees a Rs 30 lakh openingNeeraj Ghaywan's Oscar entry 'Homebound' opened to a modest Rs 30 lakh at the Indian box office, despite international acclaim and a star cast of Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Hit for not speaking Hindi: 2 students claim assault in Delhi over theft chargeCPI(M) MP John Brittas has written to Delhi Police Commissioner Satish Golchha, alleging two Kerala students were falsely accused of theft and brutally assaulted near the Red Fort on September 24 by both locals and police.

World Archery Para C'ships: Sheetal, Sarita storm into women's compound team finalSheetal Devi and Sarita pulled off a stunning performance to defeat the top-seeded Phoebe Paterson Pine and Jessica Stretton of Great Britain to reach the final of the women's compound team event on Friday, September 26.

UP headmaster who hit education officer lost temper as he was harassed: MinisterA headmaster, who assaulted an education officer in UP's Sitapur, was blamed for harassing his school teacher during which he lost temper and attacked the government official, state minister Ashish Patel said.

Is Canada becoming the top choice for Indian students after H-1B hike?For decades, the US has been the top choice for Indian students, but shifting visa policies are changing the trend. With rising costs and uncertainties around H-1B, Canada is emerging as the preferred destination for education and long-term careers.

Zomato customer shares delivery partner's 'I'm deaf, mute' text. Internet is movedFor people with special needs, the world is already more challenging than it is for others. With struggles in almost everything, opportunities for earning a livelihood shrink. But one Zomato delivery partner – with speech and hearing impairments – impressed a customer with their professionalism, and the internet is all for such inclusivity.

Trump tells Satya Nadella to fire Microsoft exec Lisa Monaco, but whyUS President Donald Trump has called for Microsoft to dismiss Lisa Monaco, citing national security risks. The demand highlights ongoing tensions between political figures and the big tech firms.

sports.headline: Suryakumar Yadav consoles Dunith Wellalage after India's Super Over win (Watch) Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav consoled Sri Lanka's Dunith Wellalage on-field after their Super 4 clash, showing empathy following Wellalage's recent bereavement. India narrowly defeated Sri Lanka on Friday.

Powerplay boom: Jasprit Bumrah's use in 1st six overs defended by India bowling coach India bowling coach Morne Morkel has defended the use of Jasprit Bumrah in the powerplay overs during the Asia Cup 2025. Bumrah has five wickets in four matches so far in the Asia Cup.

Clutch Arshdeep Singh deserves to play Asia Cup final: Irfan Pathan Irfan Pathan backed Arshdeep Singh for a spot in the Asia Cup final clash against Pakistan after his match-winning display against Sri Lanka, praising his yorker skills alongside Jasprit Bumrah.

World Archery Para C'ships: Sheetal, Sarita storm into women's compound team final Sheetal Devi and Sarita pulled off a stunning performance to defeat the top-seeded Phoebe Paterson Pine and Jessica Stretton of Great Britain to reach the final of the women's compound team event on Friday, September 26.

Cramps and dew: IND vs PAK final could turn out to be very different on Sunday India brushed aside Pakistan in two back-to-back matches in the Asia Cup. But if Friday's game against Sri Lanka is any indication, the final could turn out to be far trickier than expected.

Test door not shut on Karun Nair, West Indies snub will make him hungrier: Coach Karun Nair was left out of India's squad for the upcoming Test series against the West Indies, months after his return to the senior national team after an eight-year absence. His childhood coach, Vijay Madyalkar, believes the recent snub will only strengthen his determination.

IND vs SL Super Over controversy: Jayasuriya calls for fine-tuning of rules Sri Lanka coach Sanath Jayasuriya has called for fine-tuning of rules, after the Super Over controversy involving Dasun Shanaka during the clash against India on Friday, September 26. Shanaka had his run out reversed due to a loophole in Law 20.1.1.3.

Hardik Pandya injury scare: Will all-rounder be ready for Ind vs Pak final? Asia Cup 2025: Hardik Pandya walked off the field after bowling just one over in Friday's Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka. Bowling coach Morne Morkel stated that a decision on the all-rounder's availability will be made on the eve of the final, following an assessment of his fitness.

India's Super Over epic eats into recovery time ahead of Sunday's Asia Cup final Calling the high-scoring Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka a match that "felt like a final," India captain Suryakumar Yadav said his team would focus on a proper recovery ahead of the big Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

India get a wake-up call, need a Super Over to shake off Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2025, IND vs SL: India extended their winning run in Dubai, but they were tested by Sri Lanka in their final Super 4 match. Pathum Nissanka's 107 went in vain as Sri Lanka tied with India before losing the Super Over on Friday, September 26.

Cricket is confusing! Dasun Shanaka's run-out reversal in Super Over explained Asia Cup: Dasun Shanaka survived a run-out in the Super Over of the Super 4 clash between India and Sri Lanka, thanks to a quirky cricket rule. The incident sparked confusion and debate over the sport's intricate laws and on-field decisions.

IND vs SL Super Over controversy: Jayasuriya calls for fine-tuning of rules Sri Lanka coach Sanath Jayasuriya has called for fine-tuning of rules, after the Super Over controversy involving Dasun Shanaka during the clash against India on Friday, September 26. Shanaka had his run out reversed due to a loophole in Law 20.1.1.3.

Hardik Pandya injury scare: Will all-rounder be ready for Ind vs Pak final? Asia Cup 2025: Hardik Pandya walked off the field after bowling just one over in Friday's Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka. Bowling coach Morne Morkel stated that a decision on the all-rounder's availability will be made on the eve of the final, following an assessment of his fitness.

India's Super Over epic eats into recovery time ahead of Sunday's Asia Cup final Calling the high-scoring Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka a match that "felt like a final," India captain Suryakumar Yadav said his team would focus on a proper recovery ahead of the big Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

India get a wake-up call, need a Super Over to shake off Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2025, IND vs SL: India extended their winning run in Dubai, but they were tested by Sri Lanka in their final Super 4 match. Pathum Nissanka's 107 went in vain as Sri Lanka tied with India before losing the Super Over on Friday, September 26.

Cricket is confusing! Dasun Shanaka's run-out reversal in Super Over explained Asia Cup: Dasun Shanaka survived a run-out in the Super Over of the Super 4 clash between India and Sri Lanka, thanks to a quirky cricket rule. The incident sparked confusion and debate over the sport's intricate laws and on-field decisions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
